intro: Ricotia sinuata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ricotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has a trailing growth habit and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Ricotia sinuata is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
